Abstract

Online games are a significant part of the modern gaming ecosystem, offering a vast array of genres and engaging gameplay. However, one of the most common yet overlooked aspects in these games is water consumption. This review, based on quantitative data from 114 online game players, aims to provide a detailed analysis of the water consumption patterns observed during gameplay. The study is structured into three sections, focusing on the influence of water consumption on player performance, water consumption data across various gaming genres, and the impact of water consumption on players' hydration status.

Water consumption, Online gaming, Player performance, Hydration status
